comments.creator: philipp@bugzilla.kewis.ch
comments.text:
Often you want to process/create an object using ctypes in a worker thread, then pass it off to the main thread for not-so-time-consuming processing. This is currently not possible using js-ctypes and ChromeWorker.

If ownership is a problem, I would be fine with postMessage() handing over ownership of the ctypes object to the main thread. That helps the common use case of preparing a data structure and then handing it over to the UI so it can be used and if properly documented it shouldn't be too hard to understand.

If you are absolutely certain of what you're doing, you can pass C pointers between workers with postMessage. That's what I'm doing with OS.File in a few cases.

comments.text: C pointers is one thing, ctypes objects are a totally different thing. It is not possible to pass ctypes objects between workers and the main thread because they belong to two different JS runtimes.
